text:
Fundraiser to be held in memory of ‘superhero’ Joshua McCormack The five-year-old from Whitworth, Rochdale, died last month following a brave battle with cancer Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A fundraiser will take place this weekend in memory of ‘superhero’ Joshua McCormack. 
The five-year-old from Whitworth, Rochdale , died last month following a brave battle with cancer. 
Joshua, who was diagnosed with a rare malignant brain tumour in October 2015, had been dubbed a ‘superhero’ by thousands of people around the world who followed his fight with the disease on Facebook. 
On Sunday, February 26, supporters from across the north west will come together to raise money for Derian House children’s hospice, and Joshua’s family. 
The Superhero Joshua Super Raffle is being held as part of Monton AFC’s family fun day and includes prizes donated from local businesses including beauty products and hair treatments to tickets to local attractions like LEGOLAND Discovery and Sealife. Parents Nicola and Kevin McCormack with Josh Read More Hundreds turn out to pay tribute to brave five-year-old Josh McCormack who died of cancer 
There will also be a charity football match. 
Event organiser Lexy Ellis said: “It is great that so many people are coming together to raise funds for such a vital cause and in honour of Joshua who was simply an inspirational and amazing young man. 
“We’re hoping to raise as much as possible for Derian House and for Joshua’s family and to show our support for everyone affected by this disease.” 
Joshua passed away on January 13 and his mum Nicola invited friends to celebrate his life in an emotional post on Facebook. 
She wrote: “My best friend has gone and it’s final. 
“Life will never be the same and we now have to live with grief for an eternity. 
“One final thing we have to do as parents (which no parent should have to do) is arrange the best send-off ever for the best, most charismatic and caring son. Josh McCormack with mum Nicola Read More 80mph winds expected to hit Britain as Storm Doris arrives 
“To have a son like Joshua is every parent’s dream. Our dream came true with Joshua but lasted only 5 short years..the last of which cancer made our perfect dream become a living nightmare.” 
On the day of his funeral hundreds of mourners lined the streets to pay their respects, with Darth Vader and a collection of stormtroopers leading his funeral cortege through Whitworth. 
Joshua was a huge Rochdale FC fan and staff, players and manager Keith Hill stood with their heads bowed as the hearse passed the football club on its way to St John’s Church in Whitworth. 
He was named as a substitute for a match last November and the club retired the squad number he was assigned – 55 – in tribute after his death was announced. 
Raffle tickets and donations for the event on February 26 can be purchased by emailing superherojosh@hotmail.com via paypal. Like us on Facebook
